intro: Eunomia, commonly known as the "good order," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their erect, herbaceous stems and simple, alternate leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Eunomia species are often found in moist, disturbed soils and are sometimes considered weeds in agricultural settings.
